title_statement.title: ASRS: Adult ADHD Self-Report Scale
title_statement.subtitle: 18-item screening questionnaire for ADHD in adults

study_info.abstract: The ASRS is an 18-item self-report questionnaire developed by the World Health Organization to screen for attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) in adults. It assesses symptoms of inattention and hyperactivity-impulsivity. The scale is based on the DSM-IV criteria for ADHD and is designed for use in epidemiological studies and clinical practice.

instrument_details.response_scale: 5-point frequency scale (Never, Rarely, Sometimes, Often, Very often)
instrument_details.interpretation: 0-22: Low probability of ADHD; 23-36: Moderate ADHD symptoms; 37-72: High probability of ADHD

psychometric_properties.validity: Good concordance with clinical ADHD diagnosis

questions.question_text: How often do you have trouble wrapping up the final details of a project, once the challenging parts have been done?
How often do you have difficulty getting things in order when you have to do a task that requires organization?
How often do you have problems remembering appointments or obligations?
When you have a task that requires a lot of thought, how often do you avoid or delay getting started?
How often do you fidget or squirm with your hands or feet when you have to sit down for a long time?
How often do you feel overly active and compelled to do things, like you were driven by a motor?
How often do you make careless mistakes when you have to work on a boring or difficult project?
How often do you have trouble keeping your attention when you are doing boring or repetitive work?
How often do you have difficulty concentrating on what people are saying, even when they are speaking directly to you?
How often do you have problems organizing activities or tasks when you need to do them with others?
How often do you have trouble wrapping up the final details of a project, once the challenging parts have been done?
How often do you interrupt others when they are in the middle of something?
How often do you have trouble waiting your turn in situations when turn-taking is required?
How often do you have a hard time doing quiet activities?
How often do you feel like you are on the go or driven by a motor?
How often do you talk excessively?
How often do you have trouble starting projects or tasks?
How often do you have problems managing your time when given deadlines?
